content.question: The diagram above represents a solution of ions in water. Which of the following are the most likely identities of ions <math alttext="X" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">X</mi></math> and <math alttext="Y" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">Y</mi></math> ?

choices.label: Ion <math alttext="X" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">X</mi></math> is <math alttext="N a with a positive 1 charge" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msup><mi>Na</mi><mo>+</mo></msup></math>, and ion <math alttext="Y " display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">Y</mi></math> is <math alttext="K with a positive 1 charge" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msup><mi mathvariant="normal">K</mi><mo>+</mo></msup></math>.

Ion <math alttext="X" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">X</mi></math> is <math alttext="N a with a positive 1 charge" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msup><mi>Na</mi><mo>+</mo></msup></math>, and ion <math alttext="Y" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">Y</mi></math> is <math alttext="F with a negative 1 charge" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msup><mi mathvariant="normal">F</mi><mo>-</mo></msup></math>.

Ion <math alttext="X" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">X</mi></math> is <math alttext="C l with a negative 1 charge" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msup><mi>Cl</mi><mo>-</mo></msup></math>, and ion <math alttext="Y" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">Y</mi></math> is <math alttext="K with a positive 1 charge" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msup><mi mathvariant="normal">K</mi><mo>+</mo></msup></math>.

Ion <math alttext="X" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">X</mi></math> is <math alttext="C l with a negative 1 charge" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msup><mi>Cl</mi><mo>-</mo></msup></math>, and ion <math alttext="Y" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">Y</mi></math> is <math alttext="F with a negative 1 charge" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msup><mi mathvariant="normal">F</mi><mo>-</mo></msup></math>.

content.answer: Ion <math alttext="X" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">X</mi></math> is <math alttext="C l with a negative 1 charge" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msup><mi>Cl</mi><mo>-</mo></msup></math>, and ion <math alttext="Y" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">Y</mi></math> is <math alttext="K with a positive 1 charge" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msup><mi mathvariant="normal">K</mi><mo>+</mo></msup></math>.

skill.text: 1.A: Describe the components of and quantitative information from models and representations that illustrate particulate-level properties only.
